snippet: Boeing and General Electric received limited licenses from the Treasury Department to service 18 commercial aircraft engines sold to Iranair in the late 1970s, the companies said.
abstract: Boeing and engine maker General Electric say they have received licenses from Treasury Department to export certain parts for commercial aircraft to Iran under temporary sanctions relief deal; approval is for application to service 18 engines sold to country in late 1970s.
lead_paragraph: Boeing and General Electric received limited licenses from the Treasury Department to service 18 commercial aircraft engines sold to Iranair in the late 1970s, the companies said.

headline.main: U.S. Permits Export to Iran of Plane Parts
headline.print_headline: U.S. Permits Export to Iran of Plane Parts
